thread.title: Louis Tomlinson celebrates son Freddie's first birthday - Daily Mail
thread.title_full: Louis Tomlinson celebrates son Freddie's first birthday - Daily Mail

title: Louis Tomlinson celebrates son Freddie's first birthday - Daily Mail
text: Share 32 shares The short clip of the moment was shared on Briana's Instagram account and soon attracted plenty of gushing comments from her followers. One wrote: 'That's so cute! And it's so nice to see ya all together! Happy birthday little angel! ❤' Happy birthday: The singer placed a hand gently on Freddie's back as the tot went to blow out the candle on his birthday cake As another enthused: 'Awww so sweet I can't I wish him the happiest birthday ☺' While a third said: 'Im sooo happy for youuuu', followed by smiley face emojis. Thanking fans for their well-wishes, Louis tweeted: 'Had a special day today with my birthday boy. Thanks for all the lovely messages! (sic).' Briana's mother Tammi also took to Instagram to share a picture of herself with Freddie and she paid a special tribute to Louis's mother Johannah. Adorable: The short clip of the moment was shared on Briana's Instagram account and soon attracted plenty of gushing comments from her followers She wrote: 'Lovely day with my gorgeous grandson, Happy Birthday Freddie! We all love you so much! You have such a beautiful spirit just like your grandma Jay, missing her so much. She is your angel now watching your every step, guiding you, and in our hearts today on your special day and always (sic).' Just days ago, Louis spoke publicly for the first time about his mum's death after she lost her leukemia battle aged just 43. 'It’s not something that I feel 100 per cent comfortable talking too much about but just quickly, when I first found out the news I kind of did want to throw the towel in,' he admitted during an interview on SiriusXM Radio. 'But it was my mum who said to me that I’ve just got to keep going, telling me very sternly that she wanted me to. So I’m not doing it for her but…' Joined for his interview by DJ Steve Aoiki, he said of his emotional X Factor performance just days after her death: 'It was tough, but I felt like it was nice for me to almost have a little send off for her.' Meanwhile, Louis and actress Danielle, 21, have reportedly gone their separate ways after just over a year of dating but insiders insist there is 'no bad feeling' between them and the pair will stay friends. A source told The Sun : 'Louis and Danielle have made the decision to split up but they are still going to be mates. They’re still talking to each other and there is no bad feeling whatsoever.' There for him: The singer has been a very hands on dad since welcoming Freddie into the world
